definitions: another attempt at something previously tried or failed
act of regaining control of territory previously lost in warfare
examples: Students can request a retake of the final examination
The director ordered several retakes of the difficult scene
The army planned a retake of the occupied city
Their retake of the fortress proved strategically crucial

definitions: process of regaining control or possession of something previously lost
act of attempting something again after initial failure or dissatisfaction
examples: The retaking of the capital marked a turning point
Retaking control of the company required careful planning
The retaking of photos delayed the wedding schedule
Students began retaking their practice tests immediately

definitions: act of harming someone in response to being harmed by them
examples: The bombing was in retaliation for earlier attacks
Workers feared retaliation for reporting safety violations

definitions: chemical or material that slows down or prevents a particular process
examples: Fire retardant was dropped from helicopters onto the blaze
The fabric was treated with flame retardant for safety

definitions: act of continuing to have or hold something over time
ability to remember information or experiences after learning them
examples: Employee retention has become a priority for companies
Water retention in soil affects plant growth significantly
Poor retention of facts affects test performance greatly
His retention of childhood memories was remarkably clear

definitions: careful reconsideration of plans, ideas, or methods previously established
examples: The project failure forced a complete rethink of strategy
A rethink of company policies was long overdue

definitions: quality of being reserved or unwilling to speak freely about something
examples: Her reticence about personal matters was well known
The witness showed reticence when questioned about details

definitions: light-sensitive layer of tissue at the back of the eye
examples: The doctor examined her retina for signs of damage
A detached retina requires immediate medical attention

definitions: form of vitamin A used in skincare and dietary supplements
examples: The dermatologist recommended a retinol cream for wrinkles
Retinol supplements can improve night vision in some cases

definitions: group of advisers or associates accompanying an important person
examples: The president arrived with a large retinue of advisers
Her retinue included bodyguards and personal assistants

definitions: person who has stopped working after reaching retirement age
examples: The community center offers special programs for retirees
Many retirees move to warmer climates after leaving work

definitions: quick, clever, or angry reply to a comment or accusation
glass container with long neck used for distilling or chemical reactions
examples: Her witty retort silenced the critics immediately
He delivered a stinging retort to the unfair accusation
The chemist heated the mixture in a glass retort
Medieval alchemists used retorts for their experiments

definitions: formal withdrawal of a statement, accusation, or published claim
act of drawing something back or pulling it inward
examples: The newspaper published a retraction of the false story
His retraction came too late to prevent legal action
The retraction of landing gear occurs after takeoff
Muscle retraction is part of the healing process

definitions: process of learning new skills to perform different work tasks
examples: Job retraining programs help displaced workers find employment
The company invested heavily in employee retraining initiatives

definitions: act of moving back from a dangerous or difficult situation
quiet or secluded place where people go to rest or focus
examples: The army began its retreat at dawn
Their retreat from the market proved financially wise
She spent weekends at a mountain retreat
The meditation retreat offered peace and solitude

definitions: condition of having moved back or withdrawn from a position
examples: The retreated forces regrouped behind defensive lines
Their retreated position gave them time to plan

definitions: reduction of costs or spending, especially by cutting staff numbers
examples: The economic downturn led to widespread retrenchment
Retrenchment measures affected thousands of public sector workers

definitions: new trial of a legal case after the original trial
examples: The appeals court ordered a retrial due to procedural errors
His lawyer successfully argued for a retrial

definitions: punishment inflicted on someone as vengeance for wrong or criminal act
examples: They sought retribution for the harm done to their family
Divine retribution was a common theme in ancient mythology

definitions: act of getting something back from where it was stored or lost
examples: Data retrieval from damaged hard drives requires expertise
The retrieval of sunken treasure took years to complete

definitions: type of dog bred to retrieve game during hunting activities
examples: Their golden retriever loved swimming in the lake
Labrador retrievers make excellent family pets and service dogs

definitions: style or fashion that imitates trends from the recent past
examples: The diner had a retro 1950s theme throughout
Retro video games have become popular with younger generations

definitions: addition of new technology or features to older systems or structures
examples: The building underwent a seismic retrofit for earthquake safety
They decided to retrofit solar panels onto existing homes

definitions: consideration of past events or situations with current knowledge or perspective
examples: In retrospect, the decision to expand proved wise
Their mistakes seem obvious in retrospect

definitions: exhibition or compilation showing an artist's work over their career
review or analysis that looks back at past events or periods
examples: The museum hosted a retrospective of her photography
His retrospective included paintings from five decades
The retrospective analysis revealed important trends
They conducted a retrospective study of patient outcomes

definitions: process of bringing together parts that were previously separated or divided
examples: German reunification occurred in 1990 after decades of division
Family reunification remains a priority in immigration policy

definitions: social gathering of people who have not seen each other for some time
examples: The high school reunion brought together classmates after twenty years
Their family reunion included relatives from across the country

definitions: revolution of an engine measured as rotations per minute
examples: The engine reached 6000 revs per minute
He kept the revs low to save fuel

definitions: process of calculating the value of something again, especially currency
examples: Currency revaluation affected international trade significantly
Property revaluation led to higher tax assessments

definitions: act of making previously unknown or secret information known to others
examples: The revealing of classified documents caused a scandal
Her revealing of personal struggles inspired many readers

definitions: military bugle call used to wake personnel at sunrise
examples: Reveille sounded at 0600 hours every morning
The troops assembled quickly after hearing reveille

definitions: lively party or celebration involving dancing, drinking, and enjoyment
examples: The street revel continued until early morning
Their victory revel lasted throughout the night

definitions: lively and noisy festivities, especially involving drinking and dancing
examples: The sound of revelry echoed through the streets
New Year's Eve revelry filled the city center

definitions: prolongation of sound by reflection from surfaces causing echo
continuing and serious effect of an action or event
examples: The reverberation in the empty hall was impressive
Sound reverberation made the concert venue acoustically perfect
The reverberations of the financial crisis lasted for years
Political reverberations from the scandal continued for months

definitions: feeling of deep respect and admiration for someone or something
examples: They revere their ancestors through traditional ceremonies
Students revere the professor for his wisdom

definitions: deep respect and admiration felt for someone or something
examples: She showed great reverence for religious traditions
The reverence in his voice was unmistakable

definitions: title given to members of the clergy in various Christian churches
examples: Reverend Johnson delivered an inspiring sermon yesterday
The reverend visited sick members of the congregation

definitions: state of being pleasantly lost in one's thoughts or daydreams
examples: She was lost in reverie about her childhood
The music sent him into a peaceful reverie

definitions: change to an opposite direction, position, or course of action
adverse change of fortune or circumstances
examples: The policy reversal surprised political observers
A reversal of the court decision seemed unlikely
The team suffered a reversal in the championship game
Financial reversal forced them to sell their home

definitions: clothing item that can be worn with either side showing as the outside
examples: She bought a reversible jacket for versatile styling
The reversible raincoat had different colors on each side

definitions: return to a previous state, practice, or belief after a period of change
examples: The software update caused a reversion to factory settings
Reversion to old habits occurred during stressful times

definitions: act of going back to a previous state or condition
examples: Reverting to manual processes proved temporarily necessary
The reverting of land ownership followed legal procedures

definitions: person who writes critical assessments of books, films, or performances
examples: The food reviewer gave the restaurant five stars
Movie reviewers praised the director's innovative approach

definitions: study of material again in preparation for an examination
examples: Students should revise thoroughly before the final exam
She spent hours on revise for her driving test

definitions: process of examining and improving written work by making changes
examples: Revising the manuscript took several months to complete
The revising stage is crucial for producing quality writing

definitions: piece of written work that has been corrected or improved
process of studying material again to prepare for examinations
examples: The third revision addressed all the editor's concerns
Each revision improved the clarity of the document
Exam revision should begin weeks before the test
Her revision notes were thorough and well-organized

definitions: practice of reinterpreting historical events, often challenging accepted views
examples: Historical revisionism sparked debate among scholars
Critics accused him of dangerous revisionism

definitions: person who advocates revision of accepted historical views or political ideology
examples: Revisionist historians challenged traditional World War narratives
The revisionist presented compelling evidence for alternative interpretations

definitions: process of making something strong, healthy, or successful again after decline
examples: Urban revitalisation transformed the abandoned district
Economic revitalisation became the government's primary focus
